original_conversation.content: So I got—wait, let me just—I got an email. About late fees?
Oh okay, let me pull that up for you. What's your... hmm, what's the word I'm looking for... your rental ID number? Should be something like RTX followed by some digits.
It's, uh, RTX-4492. Look, they said—no wait—hundred fifty in fees?

RTX-4492, perfect. Alright, so I'm seeing here that the return was logged as... er, hold on, that's not—sorry, I mean it shows received on the 14th, which would make it 6 days overdue. But let me check something else here...
Six days? But I sent—actually no—I dropped it Monday.

Monday, okay. So here's what's interesting, um, I can see in our tracking that it was scanned at the drop-off location Monday at 3:47 PM, but then there's this... what do you call it... this gap where it didn't get to our processing center until Thursday. That's not on you.
Wait. Really? So I don't—the fees aren't—?

No no, absolutely not. Actually, hmm, I love when I get to fix these. So what happened was, er, basically a delay in our shipping partner's system, and I'm applying override code EDU-DELAY-22 right now to waive the entire $150 fee.
Oh my God. Okay. That's—wow. Hundred fifty gone?

Permanent as long as you rent at least twice a year, which, er, looking at your history you definitely do. Oh and one more thing—sorry, I mean I should mention—there's a grace period of 72 hours on all returns now instead of 24.
This is insane. I thought—I was sure I'd be stuck.

Nah, these things happen all the time, especially during end of semester. Your updated balance is, uh... let's see... zero dollars owed, and that $25 credit expires in 6 months, so maybe for fall semester?
Yeah. Yes. Definitely. Thank you so much.
Of course! And hey, if you ever have issues with a rental again, just reference case number CS-8847-EDU and we'll know the whole story. Good luck with the rest of finals!
